Remotely Piloted Aircraft Operator's Certificate (ReOC)
CASA Approved

Legally required to operate a drone business and employ other pilots

Unlocks advanced operational approvals (night, EVLOS, BVLOS, etc.)

Flexible operations under your business name

Legally required to operate a drone business and employ other pilots

Greater industry recognition

Training Questions Answered

Which licence should I get first?

For most people, the RePL (Remote Pilot Licence) is the best starting point. It's comprehensive, doesn't expire, and opens up the most opportunities. Choose in-class for hands-on learning or online for flexibility.

What's the difference between in-class and online RePL training?

In-class training offers hands-on practical experience with direct instructor interaction over 5 intensive days ($2,500-$3,500). Online training provides flexibility with self-paced learning and virtual components ($1,800-$2,800). Both result in the same CASA-approved certification.

How long does training take?

RePL in-class training takes 5 intensive days. Online RePL is self-paced, typically completed in 2-4 weeks depending on your schedule. RPA accreditation can be completed online in a few hours.

What are the legal penalties for unlicensed flying?

Flying commercially without proper accreditation can result in fines up to $11,100. Always ensure you have appropriate licensing before commercial operations.

Can I switch between in-class and online training?

Contact our training team to discuss switching options. Some flexibility may be available depending on your progress and course availability.
